body:
### Describe the bug

Invoke keys generated by https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/16641723b001b1172d1962e9fa80f5fafbc570f0/core/tauri/src/lib.rs#L1133-L1137 (as introduced by https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/commit/d950ac1239817d17324c035e5c4769ee71fc197d) can include the consecutive characters (`*/`), which when included in a comment, can cause the comment to close (with approximately 0.3% probability). 

![image](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/assets/17554188/757a3ea0-5974-4a39-96db-a483b4c51683)
(https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/16641723b001b1172d1962e9fa80f5fafbc570f0/core/tauri/scripts/ipc-protocol.js#L5-L13)

This means on some compilations of an app, IPC calls break entirely. 

### Reproduction

This is difficult to reproduce as it occurs on approximately 1 in every 300 compilations, but using a test invoke key of `*/` should do the trick. 

### Expected behavior

`ipc-protocol.js` should be parsed correctly and IPC requests should be possible.
